header.title: Invite A Friend
header.description: Updating Invite A Friend from 0.6.0 to 0.6.1.
header.author-notes: For further information and bug reports please visit http://www.phpbb.com/community/viewtopic.php?f=70&t=1224005

changelog.change: [Added] Possibility to transfer existing data from 0.5.4 and previous versions and make them work with new releases
[Fixed] Disable the invitation class correctly while installing
[Fixed] Unnecessary include of AutoMOD files in the installation file
[Fixed] Correct handling when changing the language while registering
[Fixed] SQL error when adding new bots
[Added] Advanced profile statistics (percent of total invitations, etc.)
[Added] Search for specific actions within the invitation log
[Added] Search for members by invitation related criteria
[Added] Log administrator actions for the invitation log
[Added] List of possible wildcards in templates
[Changed] List of invited users in profile has been removed as you can search for members now
[Improved] Show queue time in the related error message
[Improved] Show invitation limit in the related error message
[Improved] Invitation form looks more appealing now
[Fixed] Encode usernames in the registration url
[Fixed] Disable the whole modification will actually disable it now
[Fixed] Identify users-to-be related to invitations by e-mail-addresses
[Fixed] Search for specific username in the invitation log
[Fixed] Display an error if the invitation could not be sent
[Fixed] User in the same group twice
[Added] Identify invited users by e-mail address
[Added] Add users, who enter a registration key, to the selected group
[Changed] Create registration keys (even if keys are disabled) to identify friends
[Fixed] Report #020: Messenger vars not parsed in PM
[Added] Automatically create sql tables, install permissions, ...
[Added] Automatically add messages referring to installed languages
[Fixed] Report #002: 'Invite a friend' shown in navigation

action-group.diy-instructions:
When you are done with the file changes, please run the installation file using the update function at your_board_url/install/invitation.php
Delete the install folder afterwards, go to your Administrator Control Panel and be sure that the settings and permissions added during the installation are as you would like them.
Have fun.
Note: You might want to update your templates for subsilver2 style or the one of the language packages as well. Related instructions are included in the templates or languages folder if not carried out yet.
